queryContext.originalQuery: Qur'an copied by the Şehzade Korkut (SSM 100-0279)

value.name: Şehzade Korkut - Wikipedia
value.snippet: Şehzade Korkut (1469 – 13 March 1513 [1]) was an Ottoman prince who was for a short time the regent for the Ottoman throne. Early life [ edit] Although it is stated that he was born in Amasya in 1469, there is no clear record about the year of birth in the sources. He is the son of Bayezid II and Nigar Hatun. [1]

value.name: Qur'an copied by the Şehzade Korkut (SSM 100-0279) - Wikidata

value.snippet: Qur'an copied by the Şehzade Korkut (SSM 100-0279) Şehzade Korkud divanı : (inceleme - metin - dizin) Sultan Bestekârlar [Enregistrement sonore] Sultan Bestekârlar Sözlü Eserleri, Saz Eserleri: Turkish classical music composed by Ottoman Sultans: كتاب حل إشكال الأفكار في حل أموال الكفار

value.name: Şehzade Korkut - Wikiwand
value.snippet: Şehzade Korkut Born 1469 Amasya, Ottoman Empire Died 13 March 1513 (aged 43-44) Emet, Ottoman Empire Burial Orhangazi, Bursa[1] Issue Two sons Fatma Sultan Ferahşad Sultan Names Korkut bin Bayezid Han House House of Osman Father Bayezid II Mother Nigar Hatun Religion Sunni Islam Qur'an copied by Şehzade Korkut in Sakıp Sabancı Museum.

value.name: Şehzade Korkut - Wikipedia @ WordDisk
value.snippet: Qur'an copied by Şehzade Korkut in Sakıp Sabancı Museum. This manuscript is the only known example of his calligraphy and a proof, that if "Had Prince Korkut lived longer, he would undoubtedly have become one of Sheikh Hamdullah noted followers".

value.name: Şehzade Korkut - Vikipedi
value.snippet: Şehzâde Korkut’un, mektuplara müspet cevaplar vermesi üzerine, Manisa kuşatıldı. 1513'te Bergama yakınlarında yakalanan Korkut, Bursa ’ya götürülürken Emet yakınlarında Eğrigöz’de öldü. Bursa’da Orhan Gazi Türbesi civarına defnedildi. Cenazesi daha sonra Muradiye Külliyesi içindeki Şehzade Ahmed Türbesi'ne nakledilmiştir. [3]

value.name: Qur’an - Copied by Mehmed Şevki Efendi - Google Arts & Culture
value.snippet: Qur’an Copied by Mehmed Şevki Efendi 1862. Sakıp Sabancı Museum Istanbul, Türkiye. 341 folios in nesih and rik'a script, 15 lines per page. Details. Title: Qur’an; Creator: Copied by Mehmed Şevki Efendi; Date Created: 1862; Physical Dimensions: w120 x h197 mm; Type: Ink, colours and gold on paper;
